visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly sales trends using categorical time progression
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 4 categorical data points (months) with quantitative sales values. Synthetic sales figures follow a 23.8% compound monthly growth rate with realistic variance (σ=53.5), maintaining financial context through dollar-denominated values. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and redundant axis titles while preserving Tufte's fundamental lie factor through proportional column scaling. Cairo's principles are applied through pre-attentive color coding (blue for single series) and position-based comparison. Axis labels use Verdana/Arial fonts with WCAG-compliant contrast (#333 on white) to support visual accessibility. Y-axis formatting (+47% May-Aug growth) enables direct magnitude comparisons without cognitive calculation load.
